Vestige sat back as Tuscon talked, clearly not expecting to get so
much inf=
ormation in one shot. The Autobot was clearly older and weak.
However he di=
d what he could to follow everything that Tuscon said. It
seemed though tha=
t Vestige was getting weaker.

Vestige smiled sadly as Tuscon asked him abo=
ut the place, "I don't
know what I can tell you. I can only say that I have=
 been here as long
as I can remember. There was once more activity, more pe=
ople, but now
there is just me . . . me and . . . " Vestige slumped over on=
 his side
as his optics went dim.

Meanwhile outside the sound of buzzing c=
ould be heard. It was small at
first, very faint, perhaps it had been build=
ing for quite some time
but now it was clearly audible and it was getting l=
ouder and louder.

(TAG)

Preston

On Sat, Jul 17, 2010 at 12:06 AM, Sandy =
<magicquartz@...> wrote:
>
>
>
> Tucson takes a seat next to Vestige,=
 knowing that to explain everything would mean taking the time to do so in =
a personable manner.
>
> " It all started not too long ago. I had been work=
ing with Lord Perseus, a commander of the Maximals of Atlantis, we left, an=
d happened upon a planet, where we came in contact with an old Maximal base=
. From that base, I learned of what had happened to my commander, and comra=
de, Rodimus Prime. He had been abducted by Hydras, and turned against his f=
action forcefully. I heard of what happened and I knew I had to begin my ow=
n quest to try and recover Rodimus, no matter if I was destroyed in the pro=
cess while doing so. I traveled to the Black Fortress, where I had learned =
the whereabouts of Dark Rodimus, who was Rodimus but reprogrammed into a da=
rker figure and turned into a slave of Lord Hydras. It was a long battle, a=
nd at first, I did not succeed. I was rescued myself by a tiny Maximal, nam=
ed Rat Trap, who I could see desperately needed a friend, and in saving me,=
 he found one and so did I. He called for backup and I was recovered by Lor=
d Elder, a leader of a Maximal group. He had faithfully guarded the Autobot=
 Ark until such time that an Autobot would return to restore what was lost.=
 It was there where I was lead to the body of Optimus Prime, and it was the=
re where the Matrix of Leadership granted me it's power and I was given the=
 power of the Primes. Now, before this, I was known as just Tucson, an aver=
age Autobot, who fought faithfully in the wars, but suffered a great defeat=
 which left me visually impaired even today. But for some reason, right now=
, it seems to have corrected itself. "
>
> He shifts his weight and then be=
gins to tell the rest of the tale.
>
> " That leads me to your question Ves=
tige. When I was at the Black fortress, I released a bolt of energy from my=
 spark, which supposedly was supposed to heal Rodimus of any possession tha=
t Hydras may have had over him. Not at first though. He had recovered a sma=
ll fraction of his old self but was quickly overcome by the evil once more.=
 But it was not until he had sensed something within him that he made the c=
hange back to his normal self. So, we all began to proceed out of the Black=
 fortress, only to be entrapped by another enemy. An enemy which was insect=
ile, and arachnid in nature. Rodimus told me to run, and at first I did, bu=
t in my spark I knew I could not abandon him. So, I went back and proceeded=
 to search for Rodimus along with my comrades. Once we found him, he was bo=
und by countless numbers of dangerous tendrills, and the only way for me to=
 save him, was to lend my spark in efforts to save his. And that is how I g=
ot here. I will do what ever it takes to recover Rodimus. I lost him three =
times, I will not lose him again. I could have fought the arachnids, but I =
saw something disturbing in them. Their colors, they were the same as Rodim=
us Prime's.. The bright reds, oranges and yellows of his armor and vehicula=
r form. There is more to defeating the evil than meets the eye and perhaps =
you may be able to tell me about this place, and from there I can compile a=
 strategy to get Rodimus back. I don't want to make any foolish moves if I =
don't have to."
>
> --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Preston Carroll <supercy=
clonus@...> wrote:
> >
> > > <OLD>
> > >
> > > Tucson puts his hands up in =
submission, to show that he meant no harm. Obviously the mech had seen some=
 hard times and was alarmed by his pressense.
> > >
> > > " My name is Tucs=
on Prime, I'm an Autobot commander, well just became a commander. I'm very =
good friends of Optimus Prime, and comrade to Rodimus Prime. Here, see? I h=
ave the Autobot insignia. I won't hurt you, I promise. I'm actually willing=
 to help you, if you'll let me."
> > >
> > > His voice definitely matching =
that of Optimus Prime, yet just a slight different than the legendary comma=
nder of the Autobots. His body language matches that of Optimus, as does hi=
s gentile demeanor.
> >
> > What Tuscon sees as he approaches is what appea=
rs to Alpha Trion in
> > size and body shape, however as he approaches he c=
an see that the
> > colors are red and yellow with little to none of the bl=
ues that
> > decorated that venerated transformer.
> >
> > His voice is a l=
ittle different as well as he watched Tuscon with
> > careful optics and th=
en spoke, "You are a Prime?" the figure said as
> > he lowered his weapon. =
As the figure's arm drops Tuscon can see the
> > Autobot sigil on the figur=
e as well. "I am Vestige." he said, his
> > voice raspy and rough. "How did=
 you get here?"
> >
> > (TAG)

> > Preston
